The Czech Republic's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth for this year has been revised down to 3.1%, from its previous forecast of 3.6%, due to decreased export demand from Germany.
The Czech economy has been heavily reliant on exports to Germany, which accounts for approximately one-third of the country's total exports. However, Germany's economy, which is the largest in Europe, has been struggl
sampled:
